title: Power - graph of P vs V for resistors R0 and 2R0

content.question: Two resistors, one of resistance <math alttext="R sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and the other of resistance <math alttext="2 R sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, are each connected to a variable power supply. Which of the following graphs best represents the power <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math> dissipated in each resistor as a function of the potential difference <math alttext="delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Î”</mi><mi>V</mi></math> across the resistor?

choices.label: The figure shows a graph of two lines, labeled Resistor R sub 0 and Resistor 2 R sub 0, in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled delta V and the vertical axis is labeled P. The resistor R sub 0 line starts at the origin and moves up and to the right, ending high above the horizontal axis. The resistor 2 R sub 0 line starts at the origin and moves up and to the right, ending about halfway between the end of the resistor R sub 0 line and the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a graph of two lines, labeled Resistor R sub 0 and Resistor 2 R sub 0, in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled delta V and the vertical axis is labeled P. The resistor 2 R sub 0 line starts at the origin and moves up and to the right, ending high above the horizontal axis. The resistor R sub 0 line starts at the origin and moves up and to the right, ending about halfway between the end of the resistor 2 R sub 0 line and the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a graph of two curves, labeled Resistor R sub 0 and Resistor 2 R sub 0, in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled delta V and the vertical axis is labeled P. The R sub 0 curve starts at the origin and moves up and to the right, with increasing slope, ending high above the horizontal axis. The 2 R sub 0 curve starts at the origin and moves up and to the right, with increasing slope, ending halfway between the end of the R sub 0 curve and the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a graph of two curves, labeled Resistor R sub 0 and Resistor 2 R sub 0, in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled delta V and the vertical axis is labeled P. The 2 R sub 0 curve starts at the origin and moves up and to the right, with increasing slope, ending high above the horizontal axis. The R sub 0 curve starts at the origin and moves up and to the right, with increasing slope, ending halfway between the end of the 2 R sub 0 curve and the horizontal axis.

content.answer: The figure shows a graph of two curves, labeled Resistor R sub 0 and Resistor 2 R sub 0, in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled delta V and the vertical axis is labeled P. The R sub 0 curve starts at the origin and moves up and to the right, with increasing slope, ending high above the horizontal axis. The 2 R sub 0 curve starts at the origin and moves up and to the right, with increasing slope, ending halfway between the end of the R sub 0 curve and the horizontal axis.
